Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • Room

  • public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Room - a room in an adventure game. This class is part of the "The Chase" application. "The Chase" is an extremely complicated, text based adventure game. A "Room" represents one location in the scenery of the game. It is connected to other rooms via exits. The exits are labelled north, east, south, west. For each direction, the room stores a reference to the neighboring room, or null if there is no exit in that direction.
    Version:
    2013.12.18
    Author:
    Viktor Holmér

    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        public Room(java.lang.String description)
        Create a room described "description". Initially, it has no exits. "description" is something like "a kitchen" or "an open court yard".
        Parameters:
        description - The room's description.

        Parameters:
        unlockString - The string to be printed when the room is unlocked.

      • setEventCase

        public void setEventCase(java.lang.String option,
                boolean alive)
        Maps a certain option in an event to a boolean. If the boolean is true you have survived the event and picked the right option.
        Parameters:
        option - The option to set. (1, 2 or 3)
        alive - Sets the boolean alive: True if correct option, else false.

      • getEventCase

        public boolean getEventCase(java.lang.String option)
        Returns true or false based on if the chosen option is the correct option or not.
        Parameters:
        option - The option you chose. (1, 2 or 3)
        Returns:
        True if correct, else false

      • removeEvent

        public void removeEvent()
        Removes the event from the room by setting its value to null.

      • hasEvent

        public boolean hasEvent()
        Checks whether the room has an event or not.
        Returns:
        True if the room has an event, else false.

      • getExit

        public Room getExit(java.lang.String direction)
        Returns a room in a given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to which a specific room is mapped.
        Returns:
        The room located in the given direction relative to the current room.

      • getLockedExit

        public Room getLockedExit(java.lang.String direction)
        Returns a locked room in a given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to which a specific locked room is mapped.
        Returns:
        The locked room located in the given direction. Null if there is no locked room in that direction.

      • getOpposite

        public java.lang.String getOpposite(java.lang.String direction)
        Returns the opposite direction. "north" will return "south" "up" will return "down" and so on.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction input.
        Returns:
        The opposite of the direction input.

      • removeLockedExit

        public void removeLockedExit(java.lang.String direction,
                    Room neighbor)
        Removes a locked exit from a room, and turns it into a normal exit that isn't locked.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction of the locked exit to remove.
        neighbor - The room behind the locked exit.

      • setUpOpposites

        private void setUpOpposites()
        Maps "north" to "south" and so on in the HashMap called oppositeDirections.

        public boolean isTheEnd()
        Returns:
        True if room is the end, else false.

      • setTheEnd

        public void setTheEnd()
        Sets the room to the very final room, the end.

      • getLongDescription

        public java.lang.String getLongDescription()
        Return a long description of this room, of the form: You are in the kitchen. A knife is on the table. A guy named Charlie is next to the table. Exits: north west
        Returns:
        A description of the room, including exits, characters and items.
